"The kidnappers haven't contacted me." His voice was arctic. "How exactly should I rescue her?"

Margaret's composure shattered. "Adrian Valentine! Don't forget how your father died! You're the murderer! Now you want Isabella dead too?"

"Why couldn't it have been you? These years have been hell! Finally, I have a perfect daughter-in-law, and you're determined to ruin it!"

Adrian's knuckles whitened.

He stared at her, his voice deadly quiet. "Did I really kill my father?"
###Chapter 394

Margaret Valentine's accusation froze the air.

"Wasn't it you who caused your father's death?" Her shrill voice shattered the silence. "You'll never understand the pain of losing a husband!"

Adrian Valentine's knuckles turned white from clenching.

Victor Ashcroft swiftly stepped between them. "Sir, Chairman Langley is on the line. The kidnappers haven't made any demands yet."

Adrian gave a cold nod.

Evelyn Roland felt an invisible hand squeeze her heart.

She noticed Adrian's unusually harsh tone toward Margaret. In three years of marriage, she'd never heard him call her "Mom."

That five-year-old boy had only wanted a birthday surprise.

Now he carried the burden of patricide.

Margaret's affair with Vincent Langley had long been an open secret.

Evelyn's phone vibrated.

[Sis, Margaret always knew Isabella was her biological daughter.]

The message made Evelyn's pupils constrict.

If Adrian wasn't her real son...

###Chapter 395

How did she know about Vincent?

"Sebastian, Margaret's reaction was too extreme."

He fastened her seatbelt, his fingers brushing a stray lock of hair behind her ear. "Isabella being kidnapped works in our favor."

###Chapter 396

Adrian Valentine's lips curled into a sardonic smile. "Grandmother's intelligence network is truly impressive."

He'd long suspected Cassandra wasn't Margaret's biological daughter.

Margaret had deliberately raised her to be incompetent.

"If you knew, why didn't you—"

"Warn you sooner?"

Ice glinted in Adrian's eyes.

"Exactly."

Beatrice gave a cold laugh. "Why would I interfere with the perfect opportunity to get close to Vincent? Making you suspect him, encouraging you to pursue Isabella—it was all part of my plan."

She'd known all along.

Last year when Margaret framed Evelyn, Beatrice had seized the chance to transfer shares to him.

Every move had been calculated.

Adrian felt no resentment—only aching sorrow for his grandmother's decades of silent suffering.

"Your mother and Vincent were lovers in their youth. Our maid Martha witnessed their affair. Vincent had her killed."

"You were just a child then. I had to bide my time until you were old enough to seek justice for Martha."

His answer satisfied her.

"Good. Should you fail, I'll step in."

Even in her advanced years, Beatrice Valentine retained the ruthless decisiveness that had made her a formidable businesswoman in her prime.
###Chapter 397

Adrian's fingers went slack. His phone slipped onto the couch.

A bone-chilling cold seeped through his body as if he'd plunged into an ice cellar.

Grandmother had known the truth all along?

She'd simply set a trap, letting him uncover it himself.

Christian's incident, Isabella's rescue—were they all part of a scheme orchestrated by Margaret and Vincent?

Her rebellious son was finally crawling back to apologize.

The wolf cub she'd raised would never escape her grasp.

If not for his business genius, she'd have—

Venom flashed in her eyes.

Who had taken Isabella?

Margaret's expression darkened.

Their daughter was kidnapped, yet they wandered about leisurely?

He'd suspected his wife arranged the kidnapping, but her distress seemed genuine.

With the Academy Awards approaching, they couldn't afford to lose this pawn.

How dare these traitors show their faces?
###Chapter 398

Vincent Langley's face darkened as his gaze shifted between the two.

"Enough! This isn't the time for infighting. Finding Isabella is our priority."

###Chapter 399

###Chapter 400

Slap!

Vincent's expression turned venomous. "Press send, and you'll never see your child again."

The air thickened with tension.
###Chapter 401

###Chapter 402

Margaret Valentine staggered backward, her fingers trembling.

Her carefully woven lies had been mercilessly exposed in this moment.

"Mother?" A cold laugh echoed from the shadows. "A mother who murdered her own husband?"

Margaret screamed uncontrollably. "Show yourself!"

Vincent's eyes darkened with malice. "Hiding like a coward? If you have proof, present it!"

"You destroyed the evidence long ago," the voice mocked. "But whether Adrian believes it—that's up to him."

The sea wind howled.

Adrian stared at Vincent. "You expect me to trust a murderer?"

"Bravo!" The mysterious figure suddenly laughed. "Adrian, here's a gift for you!"

The ceiling shattered with a deafening crash.

Two ropes slowly descended.

Evelyn Roland and Isabella Langley hung in midair, bound and gagged.

Adrian's pupils constricted violently.

A torrent of ice-cold water poured down.

Evelyn jolted awake.

Her wet hair clung to her face as she blinked in confusion.

Beneath her feet, the ocean waves churned violently.

"Isabella?" She turned to the woman bound beside her. "What's happening?"
###Chapter 403

Isabella's eyes were bloodshot, her nails digging deep into her palms.

Vincent Langley had actually killed Adrian's father.

Margaret Valentine had known her father in their youth.

The most absurd part? Margaret was her biological mother.

These truths carved into her heart like knives.

"Evelyn! This is all your doing!" Isabella shrieked hysterically.

Evelyn gave her a cold glance. "Psycho."

Dizzy, she leaned against the wall and closed her eyes.

The sedative hadn't fully worn off yet.

"Who are you calling a psycho?" Isabella trembled with rage.

Evelyn ignored her.

The former award-winning actress now looked like a disheveled madwoman.

"Accurate description," a mechanized voice suddenly remarked.

Evelyn whipped her head around.

The voice was distorted, impossible to identify as male or female.

"Why kidnap me?" She suppressed her anger.

Being suspended midair made her nauseous.

"To show you a good show," the voice taunted. "Look down."

Evelyn glanced below.

Adrian, Vincent, and Margaret were all there.

Eleanor Langley lay unconscious in Vincent's arms.

Evelyn's heart skipped a beat.

Wasn't this the cliché trope from soap operas?

Forcing the male lead to choose.

She'd just seen a similar short video days ago.

The male lead always picked his first love.

Evelyn briefly locked eyes with Adrian.

His lips pressed into a thin line—he clearly understood the kidnapper's intention.

"Adrian Valentine, choose one," the mechanical voice demanded coldly. "Whoever you pick, I'll spare."

Evelyn rolled her eyes.

Predictable.

She must have missed crucial plot points while unconscious.

Why was Eleanor unconscious?

Who kidnapped Isabella?

"Boring." Evelyn scoffed. "The whole world knows Adrian loves Isabella. Just throw me into the sea already."

"Hahaha—" The voice erupted into grating laughter.

Evelyn frowned. "Stop laughing. It's awful."

She mocked, "All this just to watch Adrian make a choice? How childish."
###Chapter 404

"Evelyn, you're underestimating yourself. To Adrian, you might mean far more than you think."

Evelyn scoffed, not even bothering to glance at Adrian.

Was he insane?

Playing such childish games?

"Adrian, choose. The one you don't pick gets thrown into the sea for the sharks."

The icy voice seemed to come from all directions.

Adrian's gaze flickered between Isabella and Evelyn, his Adam's apple bobbing with difficulty.

Isabella stomped her foot in frustration. "Adrian, have you forgotten who your true love is? You have to choose me!"

Margaret shrieked, "Adrian, Isabella is family! Why save that worthless Evelyn?"

"Shut up!" Adrian snapped. "Who's the real disgrace here? You had an affair with Vincent and bore his child, yet you dare speak?"

Evelyn arched a brow.

So Adrian knew the truth.

Too bad she'd missed the drama.

Margaret's face flushed crimson—that video was her greatest humiliation.

Evelyn had already accepted Adrian wouldn't choose her. She closed her eyes, waiting to be tossed into the sea.

Her guards were nearby. They wouldn't reveal themselves unless absolutely necessary.

That strange scent earlier...

A knockout fragrance potent enough to render someone unconscious instantly—only the Northern Capital had such formulas.

Who was truly behind this?

"Adrian, I've been terrified of water since childhood. Please, choose me! My fans are watching," Isabella pleaded, unable to meet his gaze.

The secret was out—her father had killed Adrian's.

With Margaret's scandal added to the mix, any chance between her and Adrian was over.

"Adrian, I'll count to three. If you don't choose, both go overboard!"

"One... Two—"

"I choose—"

"Isabella." The final words came in Adrian's voice—but it was Vincent who'd spoken.

Evelyn didn't catch the deception, believing Adrian had chosen Isabella.

Her heart wrenched violently.

Even expecting it didn't dull the pain.

Weightlessness seized her.

"No—Evelyn!" Adrian's scream tore through the air.

In his memory, Evelyn had never learned to swim.

As he lunged forward, another figure moved faster.

"Evelyn!"

Sebastian dove into the sea like an arrow loosed from its bow.

Isabella was lowered slowly, triumph written across her face.

Adrian had chosen her after all.

But when she saw Adrian's desperate stare fixed on the churning waters, her eyes darkened with venom.

He still cared for Evelyn.
###Chapter 405

In the icy seawater, Sebastian Orlando held Evelyn Roland tightly around the waist, swimming desperately toward shore.

Adrian Valentine stood on the deck, watching their entwined figures. His heart felt torn apart.

He whirled toward Vincent Langley, eyes blazing with fury.

Vincent adjusted his cuffs calmly. "Adrian, I could only save my daughter."

He signaled to Margaret Valentine. "Margaret, take Isabella. We're leaving."

Adrian turned away without another word.

As he reached the cabin door, Victor Ashcroft approached with a bound man in tow.

"Sir, this is the shooter. He used tranquilizer darts."

Vincent smiled serenely. "Careful with baseless accusations."

A flicker of murderous intent crossed Vincent's eyes. "Don't let rumors destroy our bond."

"Bond?" Adrian sneered. "You slept with this woman and fathered Isabella. That's your gift to me?"

Isabella Langley paled.

Margaret shrieked hysterically. "Adrian! Must you destroy me?"

He looked at her with disgust. "You ruined my father, then tried to ruin me. Gregory isn't a Valentine. Isabella and I share blood, yet you pushed us together."

"Tonight, I'm cleaning house."

Margaret staggered back, face ashen.

She realized with horror—Adrian knew far more than she'd imagined.

"You...how can you not be my son?" she stammered.

Adrian yanked a hair from her head, then one from his own. "Run the paternity test."

Margaret collapsed, her decades-long scheme crumbling.

"How could you be so cruel?" she whispered hopelessly.

Adrian's gaze remained icy. "You kept grasping for power. Last time, you framed Evelyn. Grandmother knew everything—she just played along."

Margaret froze.

The old woman had been laughing at her all along.
###Chapter 406

Margaret Valentine's eyes turned icy as her nails dug deep into her palms.

The old fool had ruined her carefully laid plans.

Isabella Langley gazed tearfully at Adrian Valentine. "Adrian..."

"Shut up!" Adrian's face twisted in disgust. "Don't call me that."

Isabella paled. She'd known Margaret arranged this marriage precisely because they weren't blood-related.

She refused to give up. "Adrian, those are just rumors. How could my father possibly—"

Adrian's razor-sharp gaze sliced toward Vincent Langley. "Mr. Langley, how does it feel to scheme against the Valentines for years only to fail at the last moment?"

Vincent cradled his unconscious wife Eleanor, murky eyes boiling with murderous intent.

Everything had gone wrong. The plan was to control Adrian through marriage and then swallow the entire Valentine empire.

Now it was all over.

He forced a smile. "Adrian, you shouldn't make baseless accusations."

Isabella desperately grabbed Adrian's sleeve. "Adrian, I knew nothing about this. I truly love you—"

"Love?" Adrian sneered. "After what your father and Margaret did, you dare speak of love?"

Isabella whirled toward Margaret, eyes blazing. "You knew the truth and still tricked me into this marriage? I'll never acknowledge you as my mother!"

Margaret trembled. Was this the daughter she'd longed for all these years?

Isabella lunged at Vincent, hysterical. "Dad! How could you do this to Mom? She was so beautiful, so kind—"

Staggering back, she turned toward the exit.

"Isabella!" Margaret sobbed, chasing after her.

Isabella spun around, venom in her eyes. "Don't follow me! You destroyed everything!"

If she couldn't have Adrian, then Evelyn Roland wouldn't either.

She pulled out her phone and dialed Warren Garten's number.
###Chapter 407

"Inform the Lefèvre family that Evelyn Roland was responsible for Christian Lefèvre's death. Adrian Valentine wants to protect her? Wishful thinking."

Isabella Langley finally pieced everything together.

Adrian had likely known her father was the murderer all along. Getting close to her was just a ploy to extract the truth.

Their two years of so-called marital bliss had been nothing but a performance for outsiders.

He had never truly touched her.

The way Adrian had looked at Evelyn earlier—that unmistakable affection still lingering in his eyes—made Isabella realize she had been a complete fool.

Adrian had used her from the very beginning.

Her fists clenched, nails digging deep into her palms.

She wouldn’t let any of them get away with this.

Meanwhile.

Vincent Langley received a call—Dominic Lombardi had been arrested for sexually assaulting one of their artists.

Remembering the evidence Dominic held, Vincent's face darkened. He glared at Adrian, who lounged across from him with infuriating calm. "You did this?"

Adrian smirked, then turned to leave with Victor Ashcroft in tow.

His bodyguards released Vincent's men.

At the docks, Adrian watched from a distance as Sebastian Orlando carried Evelyn ashore.

The two collapsed onto the muddy beach, utterly exhausted.

Adrian stood frozen, his knuckles turning white.

"Sir, now is the perfect time to strike back," Victor murmured.

Adrian didn’t move.

The bitter wind howled around them.

Minutes later, a black car screeched to a halt.

Sebastian helped Evelyn inside, and they sped away.

Only then did Adrian return to the Valentine estate.

Cassandra Valentine, Gregory Valentine, and Margaret Valentine—who had rushed back—were all waiting for him.

Margaret eyed her adopted son with icy disdain, the air thick with tension.

"Adrian Valentine, what exactly are you trying to pull?" she snapped. "You’re not even a real Valentine."

If they were tearing off the masks, then let it be a fight to the death.

Adrian’s gaze turned glacial, like the abyss itself.

Margaret faltered under that piercing stare—sharp as a blade.

She forced herself to hold his gaze.

Gregory, still groggy from a hangover, perked up at the revelation.

"Mom, what did you say?" He jumped to his feet, grinning. "Does that mean I’m the sole heir now?"

Cassandra gasped, covering her mouth in shock.

Margaret shot her useless youngest son a withering look.

"Hahaha!" Gregory pointed at Adrian, laughing wildly. "How does it feel now? I’m the true Valentine heir!"

He turned eagerly to his mother. "Call Uncle and the others! I want to watch this impostor get thrown out myself!"
###Chapter 408

Margaret Valentine's temple throbbed as she glared at her worthless son.

Victor Ashcroft smirked, savoring Gregory Valentine's deranged expression. "Gregory, you don't even know whose blood runs in your veins."

Gregory froze, eyes bloodshot. "Victor! Who the hell do you think you are? This is Valentine family business!"

Victor remained silent.

He'd waited too long for this moment.

Gabrielle's pupils constricted, nails digging into her palms.

"How dare you!" she shrieked. "You're just a servant!"

Martha Dimucci supported the elderly woman, who wore an elegant maroon cheongsam.

"Don't worry, CEO." Victor gave a bitter smile. "Madam kept me by your side to uncover the truth about the chairman's murder... and to avenge my mother."

Gabrielle trembled violently, her gaze locked on Victor's face.

Features began overlapping with a face from her memories.

"Housekeeper Tong's son..." she whispered.

Victor had always been flawless in his duties—except when it came to Evelyn Roland.

"You old hag!" Gabrielle screamed. "You can't just make baseless accusations!"

"Evidence?" She stroked the jade bracelet on her wrist. "Of course I have some."

Gabrielle's face turned deathly pale.
###Chapter 409

###Chapter 410

Margaret Valentine froze.

The disgust in her son's eyes chilled her to the bone.

The old lady's prophecy had finally come true.

Everything she'd schemed for had crumbled to dust.

Her own children disowned her.

Reuniting with her daughter.

That man held her fate in his hands.

The man was terrifying.

Martha's death and the elder Valentine's demise—she was involved.

Never expected the truth to surface.

The Valentine heir's golden halo—shattered.

Wealth and privilege—gone like smoke.

Her son only cared about money and status.

Just like her younger self.

In her reckless youth, she'd roamed the streets.

Then she met Vincent Langley.

And foolishly gave herself to him.

Vincent was a notorious womanizer.

Only stopped after... certain incidents.

"You plotted to kill my grandson."

"I'll see you dead, you old hag!"

Dream on.

Reinforcements were coming.

She'd prepared backup plans after the elder Valentine's death.

So the mastermind would finally show himself.

She'd waited so long for this.

To expose them all.

At Beatrice's command, Victor Ashcroft strode toward the exit.

Margaret panicked.

The message had been sent.

He should be here by now.

She couldn't let them arrest her child.

Even if Gregory denied her.

He was still her flesh and blood.

Victor had concrete evidence.

This time, even she wouldn't escape.
###Chapter 411

That man who made every socialite in Vienna swoon—far more captivating than Vincent ever was.

###Chapter 412

Monica Valentine knew the game was over. She couldn't comprehend how her meticulously laid plans had collapsed at the final moment.

#Langley Group Assistant Dominic Lombardi Pleads Guilty#

###Chapter 416

Sophia Blanchet burst into the room like a whirlwind.

Evelyn instinctively recoiled. "Do I have to?"

"No exceptions." Victoria's expression was stern. "You'll regret it when the fever returns."

Pinching her nose, Evelyn downed the bitter concoction, grimacing at the taste.

"Here." Sophia offered a piece of candied winter melon. "Your favorite."

Evelyn popped the sweet into her mouth, letting the sugary flavor neutralize the bitterness. As a child, she'd mistaken the translucent treats for fatty pork, salivating over them.

"I'm leaving." Evelyn grabbed her purse.

Sophia slung her backpack over her shoulders. "I'm coming with you."

"Aren't you tired?"

"Slept on the plane." Sophia looked refreshed.

They hurried out the door. Evelyn had tracked Adrian and Isabella to a private club for their secret meeting.
###Chapter 417

Inside the private lounge.

The crystal chandelier cast a cold glow as Adrian Valentine tapped the table with his slender fingers.

Isabella Langley gazed at him with infatuation.

"Adrian, is there really no chance for us?"

His lips curled into a mocking smile. "Miss Langley, time to wake up from your fantasy."

The icy contempt in his eyes made her shiver.

"We're not blood-related! My father's actions have nothing to do with me!"

Adrian's fingers stilled.

"That's your problem."

Isabella clenched and unclenched her fists. "Can't you let go of vengeance? Isn't our love enough?"

A low chuckle escaped him.

"Your father murdered mine, and you expect me to forget?"

Tears welled in her eyes. "But I love you!"

He flung his phone before her.

"Love?" His voice dripped with disdain. "See how well you entertained your driver."

Obscene sounds erupted from the device.

Isabella turned deathly pale. "This is a setup! It must be Evelyn!"

Adrian's face twisted in disgust.

"Your driver had a recording fetish."

The revelation struck her like lightning.

She suddenly remembered the earlier blackmail.

"He forced me!"

Adrian stood, adjusting his cuffs.

"Not my concern."

Her eyes darkened with malice.

"Then I'll tell the Lefèvres that Evelyn killed Christian!"

Murderous intent radiated from Adrian instantly.

Meanwhile.

At the club entrance.

A noblewoman blocked Evelyn's path.

"You're Evelyn Roland?"

Evelyn narrowed her eyes. "Yes."

The woman raised her hand to strike.

Sophia Blanchet seized her wrist like lightning.

"Looking to die?" Sophia's gaze turned glacial.

Tears streamed down the woman's face. "My son merely spoke against you, and you killed him?"

Evelyn's pupils contracted.

"Who are you?"

"Christian Lefèvre's mother!" the woman shrieked. "Murderer!"

Evelyn's expression frosted over.

"You claim I killed him?"

"Someone sent me proof!" Madame Lefèvre screamed hysterically. "You set that fire!"
###Chapter 418

"Bullshit! My sister would never kill over mere words. The real murderer is still out there. We're here to uncover the truth."

Sophia Blanchet hadn't expected the other party to strike first.

Now they were smearing her sister as a killer.

Evelyn Roland watched Mrs. Lefèvre's devastated expression. As a mother herself, she understood that pain.

"Mrs. Lefèvre, do you honestly believe I'd kill for such a petty reason? The person who sent you that evidence—did they truly want to reveal the truth? Or were they using you as their weapon?"

Mrs. Lefèvre froze.

That person had indeed promised revenge if Evelyn died.

"Then prove it wasn't you."

Evelyn clenched her fists. She had children too. Anyone who harmed them would face her wrath.

"I have evidence. Give me three days, Mrs. Lefèvre. Unless you want the Lefèvre family to fall next. First the Ashcrofts, then the Roscentes—who stands to gain from all this? You know the answer."

Mrs. Lefèvre paled.

A sudden realization struck her. She rushed toward the door, forgetting her purse.

Then she hesitated.

Something about Evelyn's words nagged at her.

But finding Julian Roscente took priority now.

If the Lefèvres were targeted, that woman's son would benefit most.

She'd already lost one child. She couldn't lose her daughter too.

Evelyn and Sophia headed straight for the penthouse.

As the door opened, Adrian Valentine was leaving.

The man looked as striking as ever, his peach-blossom eyes icy despite their charm.

Seeing Evelyn, he stiffened.

Before he could speak, a slap cracked across his face.

Isabella Langley gasped.

Was this woman insane?

Then Evelyn turned and struck Isabella too.

"Evelyn! How dare you hit me?" Isabella shrieked, clutching her cheek.

Evelyn smirked. "You deserve it, both of you. Adrian, I should've let you burn in that fire."

Adrian's pupils contracted.

Isabella's face drained of color.

Their secret was out.
###Chapter 419

"Evelyn, what do you mean? You were the one who saved me that day?" Adrian's voice trembled, his eyes swirling with complex emotions.

Evelyn stared at him coldly. "Who else? Did you really think Isabella could carry you out of a burning building with that frail frame of hers?"

She flung a stack of photos and documents onto the table.

"See for yourself. Isabella and Christian had been dating for a year. That day, you were supposed to meet Christian at Nata Tower. I wanted to surprise you."

"The moment I arrived, the building was already on fire. I rushed in and pulled you out. By the time I went back for Christian, you were gone."

She pointed to a surveillance still. "This shows Isabella taking you away. You two had planned Christian's murder together."

Evelyn turned to Isabella, her gaze icy. "Christian gave you his heart. Even his business trips were just excuses to see you."

"One was his girlfriend, the other his closest friend. Yet you both conspired to kill him. And now you dare meet here in secret? Disgusting."

"To pin the blame on me—how much lower can you sink?"

Her chest heaved violently, her fingertips trembling slightly.

Adrian picked up the photos with shaking hands. In one, Isabella nestled in Christian's arms, both smiling sweetly. Another showed them at a gala abroad.

"How...?" He had seen Evelyn set the fire with his own eyes.

Isabella paled. Where had Evelyn gotten these?

Evelyn read her thoughts. "Isabella, we were never switched at birth. You grew up overseas. You know that city inside out."

"You used my name to lure Christian there but met him yourself. This was your plan from the start."

"No wonder the Lefèvres insisted I killed Christian. You framed me first to cover your tracks."

Adrian felt as if struck by lightning. From the very beginning, Isabella had been manipulating him.

She had even outmaneuvered Evelyn.

When he learned someone in the Valentine family wanted Evelyn dead, and discovered Isabella was Vincent Langley's daughter—combined with witnessing Evelyn set the fire—he had pretended to fall for Isabella to drive Evelyn away.

His grandmother was aging. Uncovering his father's killer couldn't wait.

But today's revelations shattered his plans.

He never wanted Evelyn dragged into the Valentine family's quagmire.

He had tried to outplay Isabella, only to be outplayed himself.

And in the end, his wife paid the price.

Isabella spat blood, her voice venomous. "Evelyn, you started that fire! Adrian and I saw it with our own eyes—you're the murderer!"

Slap!

Evelyn struck her again.

"Ah!" Isabella cried out, nearly toppling from her chair.

Evelyn smirked. "Isabella. Adrian. I have a special gift prepared for you both."

As she reached the door, several police officers blocked her path.

The lead detective bore a striking resemblance to Christian—his half-brother.

"Evelyn Roland?" He flashed his badge. "We need you to come with us."
###Chapter 420

Evelyn narrowed her eyes at the police officers before her.

She turned to Isabella, who wore a triumphant smirk. The gleam in Isabella's eyes seemed to say: Do you like my gift, Evelyn?

If she couldn't have Adrian, then neither could Evelyn.

Adrian stepped forward, blocking the officers. "What business do you have with my wife?"

Evelyn shot him a cold glance. He'd refused to acknowledge her as his wife before—now the word rolled off his tongue so easily.

Isabella stood frozen in the hospital room, as if struck by lightning. Her gaze burned into Adrian's back, brimming with hatred.

She should have known Adrian was only using her. Yet she'd foolishly believed he loved her.

Vincent arched a brow at Adrian. "Mr. Valentine, did I hear correctly? You're calling Evelyn your wife?"

Before Adrian could respond, Evelyn cut in. "Ignore him. His fiancée is lying in that hospital bed. He must be confused."

Adrian's expression darkened.

Vincent chuckled. "I heard the Valentine family has been through quite some turmoil lately. The stress must be getting to you."

Evelyn nodded. "Clearly."

Adrian met her gaze briefly before lowering his eyes in silence.

Evelyn turned to Sophia. "Come for me in two days."

Sophia gave a knowing nod. "Take care, sis."

To the officers, Evelyn said, "I'll go with you."

Only if she was arrested would Isabella let her guard down.

Adrian frowned. "You're really going with them?"

Evelyn scoffed. "Isn't this what you and Isabella wanted? Why pretend to care now?"

"That's not what I meant."

"Then what did you mean? You schemed to frame me, and now you've succeeded. Shouldn't you be celebrating?"

Without another glance, Evelyn walked away.

Adrian stood rooted in place, watching as she was led off.

Sophia shook her fist at him. "Adrian Valentine, watch your mouth. My sister is not your wife—Isabella is. When Evelyn was at her lowest, you were off gallivanting with that woman. Sebastian Orlando is the only one worthy of being her husband. You're nothing!"

Adrian grabbed her arm. "What did you just say? When was she at her lowest?"

"Your wife? Are you insane? The whole world knows Isabella is your wife. You two deserve each other—stay the hell away from my sister!"

His gaze turned stormy, but he could only watch as Sophia stormed off.
###Chapter 421

Adrian Valentine dialed Victor Ashcroft's number.

The call connected instantly.

"Bring two men," Adrian's voice was dangerously low.

Within minutes, Victor arrived with two bodyguards in tow.

Isabella Langley tried to leave but collided with Adrian's group.

"Adrian, what's the meaning of this?" She took a wary step back.

Adrian gave Victor a silent signal.

"Pick up those photos. Make her see clearly." His tone could freeze hell.

Victor bent to retrieve the pictures. His pupils constricted violently.

"Christian Lefèvre?" He looked up, stunned. "Isabella, what's your connection to him?"

The intimate poses in the photos burned Victor's retinas.

A realization struck him. "Wait—Christian's mysterious girlfriend abroad..."

Adrian stiffened as if an invisible hand crushed his heart.

Isabella bit her lower lip raw.

She couldn't confess. Admitting this would validate Evelyn's accusations.

"I don't understand," she turned away.

Christian had loved her deeply. Pity he lacked Adrian's ruthless ambition.

His weakness was his own undoing.

Only a man like Adrian deserved her.

Now everything lay in ruins.

Destroyed by her own parents.

Adrian advanced, his gaze sharper than daggers.

"Last chance, Isabella." Each syllable dripped ice. "What was your relationship with Christian? How did he die?"

Trembling under his intensity, tears spilled down her cheeks.

If he wanted the truth, she'd make him suffer eternally.

"Heh..." Her swollen face twisted into a grotesque smile.

"Adrian, you killed Christian! Evelyn's the murderer!" She shrieked hysterically. "The verdict drops soon. If you truly want justice, tell the Lefèvres the truth!"

"You're divorcing Evelyn to save your own skin, aren't you?"

Murderous intent swirled in Adrian's eyes.

Victor stared at his friend in shock.

Now he understood why Adrian had him investigate Christian's death.

"Isabella," Victor interjected coldly, "I've uncovered some leads."

He locked onto her evasive gaze. "Christian did have a girlfriend in Eastalia. Bought her an apartment. Which now belongs to you, correct?"

Isabella's face drained of color.

She never anticipated Victor's investigation would go this far.
###Chapter 422

The phone vibrated.

Adrian Valentine received a photo.

The woman in the picture was Isabella Langley.

His fingertips turned ice cold.

He handed the phone to Isabella.

Nathan Aldridge's gaze fell on the photo.

A murderous aura erupted around him.

Isabella clenched her fists.

That bitch Evelyn Roland just wouldn't stay dead.

Her father should have strangled her years ago.

Prove it.

CRASH—

The coffee table overturned.

A glass shattered at Isabella's feet.

Nathan hadn't lost control like this in years.

Nathan's lips curled into a chilling smile.

Tomorrow, he'd make her wish for death.

Gregory Valentine was still watching like a vulture.

It wasn't time yet.

The elevator doors closed.

Blood snaked across the metal floor like a serpent.
###Chapter 423

Adrian Valentine's stern expression remained unyielding. "Unnecessary."

Victor Ashcroft stared at his bloodstained oxfords, brows furrowed.

The man was stubborn as a mule.

A flicker passed through Adrian's eyes. His gaze dropped to the blood seeping through his leather shoes.

This was the punishment he deserved.

This child inexplicably softened him every time.

He was a Valentine!

He'd just changed into this suit.

Was the man forged from steel?
###Chapter 424

What could he possibly uncover in that short time?

They'd used Isabella to investigate his father's old case. Now Evelyn was convinced Adrian had conspired with Isabella to kill Christian.

Adrian closed his eyes, his Adam's apple bobbing.

He hadn't believed her when it mattered most.

He didn't deserve her.

He'd already taken care of that long ago.
###Chapter 425

Isabella dragged her exhausted body back to the mansion.

Since this mother refused to acknowledge her, Isabella wouldn't let her have anything.

After all, she herself had crawled out of that vulgar woman's womb.

Both mother and daughter were disasters.

Eleanor curled up in pain, gasping for breath.

Isabella clutched her head in agony. Her complex personality contained both kindness and darkness.

She had once been so happy to have such a perfect mother.

She abruptly pulled back, gripping Eleanor's shoulders fiercely. "Mom, be my mother alone from now on, okay? Don't look for your real daughter. I'll take good care of you."

Eleanor stared coldly at the deranged Isabella. But to survive and see her daughter again, she had to endure the humiliation.

With tears in her eyes, she nodded. She knew Isabella's methods well—killing without bloodshed was her specialty.

Isabella beamed with joy. "Thank you, Mom! Only this way can your real daughter grow up safely."

Eleanor's heart lurched. Did Isabella already know who her daughter was?

Vincent seized the opportunity. Remembering he needed Eleanor's cooperation tomorrow, his tone softened. "Eleanor, as long as you behave and never mention that matter again, I promise your daughter's safety. Take good care of Isabella from now on, and I'll give you the antidote."

Eleanor stared at this hypocritical man, her stomach churning.

She knew Vincent had some genuine affection for her—after all, her face brought him prestige.

Thinking of tomorrow's award ceremony where her mother's presence was required, Isabella also coaxed gently. "Mom, if you agree, I promise your daughter will be safe. Just nod if you're willing."

###Chapter 426 

Eleanor Langley nodded slowly. She was willing to pay any price to find her biological daughter.

Adrian Valentine had already uncovered the truth. The murderer who killed his father was none other than Vincent Langley.

Yet Vincent remained unshaken.

Dominic Lombardi would take the fall for everything.

The old case left no evidence behind. Adrian had no way to touch Vincent.

Reporting to the police was useless, but she knew Adrian wouldn’t let this go.

Did he really think he only had one son?

Vincent had sowed his wild oats in his youth, especially with that influential man’s daughter. If that connection were acknowledged, Vincent’s status would skyrocket.

As for Isabella, that madwoman—her fate was already sealed.

Isabella had to die.

Eleanor was surprised.

Vincent relaxed slightly. "If Adrian won’t side with us, he’s the enemy."

The truth cut like a knife. Isabella’s eyes burned with unshed tears.

So Adrian had been using her all along.

She had schemed against him, but he had outmaneuvered her.

She’d already given all the evidence to Vincent Kemnis. If he couldn’t even handle Evelyn Roland, he didn’t deserve the Lefèvre inheritance.

In this house, she trusted no one.

When interests were at stake, true colors showed.

Even more ruthless than herself.

Vincent patted her shoulder. "Don’t worry. I won’t let her cause more trouble."

His daughter’s actions could ruin him too.
###Chapter 427

###Chapter 428

Top floor of Lunaris Group headquarters.

Valentine Mansion.

###Chapter 429

Adrian sat across from her, his gaze burning. "I did see you set that fire."

Tear tracks glistened on her pale face under the lights.

Adrian's heart twisted violently.

He reached to wipe her tears—only to have his hand slapped away.

"Don't touch me!" Evelyn took two steps back. "We were over the moment you chose to believe Isabella."

Adrian's hand froze midair.

"That fire..." His voice turned hoarse. "I'll prove it to you."

Evelyn turned with a bitter laugh. "Don't bother."

The metal door clanged shut behind her.

Adrian stared at her retreating figure, his eyes darkening.

"Investigate Isabella." Adrian bit out each word. "Start from three years ago."

Outside, the storm raged on.
###Chapter 430

Adrian Valentine swallowed hard under Evelyn Roland's mocking gaze.

Every explanation stuck in his throat.

He knew she wouldn't believe him.

She was convinced he had conspired with Isabella Langley to kill Christian Lefèvre.

No explanation would matter anymore.

He immediately regretted it.

Adrian claimed he saw her light the fire?

But by the time she arrived, the flames were already out of control.

The evidence Vincent Kemnis held was likely this very "eyewitness testimony."

Isabella had played her cards brilliantly.

Two men dancing to her tune—

The other died for her.

Three days would be enough for Sophia Blanchet to uncover the truth.

Inside the black sedan.

###Chapter 431

She needed release.

With the Valentine Group's discreet maneuvering.

No one suspected last night's basement frenzy.

Or noticed the faint bruises peeking above her collar.

###Chapter 443

"This has nothing to do with me. I told you—I'll save my own wife. I don't need your help."

Sebastian laughed, loud and mocking.

"Adrian, stop lying to yourself. I watched Evelyn grow up. I know her better than anyone. Once she decides she's done loving you, she'll never look back."

"Years ago, she married you in secret, forcing everyone to accept it. No one said a word then."

"But after how you've treated her now, you think you can just pick up where you left off? You're delusional."

With Adrian's face drained of color, Sebastian strode away.

Adrian felt as if he'd been plunged into an icy abyss.

He clenched his fists, the reality of Evelyn's resolve and indifference hitting him hard.

Those eyes that had once been filled with love now held nothing but calm detachment when they looked at him.

A wave of panic surged through him.

At the thought of Isabella, a ruthless glint flashed in his eyes.

When he returned to his car, Victor was crouched by the roadside, shoveling noodles into his mouth.

Spotting Adrian, he scrambled to his feet like an overworked employee.

Adrian's voice was frigid. "Release the evidence of Vincent's bribery."

Without another word, he got into the car and dialed Nathan's number.

Victor hastily finished his noodles and rushed off to arrange it.

Meanwhile, at the Langley mansion, Vincent was drinking merrily with Warren.

After several rounds, he staggered back to his room, drunk.

Eleanor was changing into her nightgown, her graceful figure partially visible.

Vincent's interest stirred, and after their intimacy, he fell asleep instantly.

But Eleanor tossed and turned, unable to sleep.

Her thoughts kept returning to the daughter she had lost years ago.

A news alert suddenly popped up on her phone.

When she opened it, her face paled in horror.

She shook her husband violently. "Vincent! Wake up! Something terrible has happened!"
###Chapter 444

Vincent Langley was sound asleep when Eleanor Langley's voice jolted him awake.

He rolled over with irritation, turning his back to his wife.

If it weren't about their son's future, she wouldn't bother with this mess.

She'd have peace if Vincent ended up in prison.

"Vincent! Wake up! It's an emergency!"

Eleanor's shout echoed through the bedroom.

Vincent bolted upright, his gaze dazed.

Recognizing his wife, his expression darkened. "What madness is this in the middle of the night?"

His hands trembled as he took the phone, watching the viral video spreading online.

Thud!

All his careful planning, so close to success.

He should have been elected last year if not for the sabotage.

He'd suspected Adrian Valentine, but they had no direct conflict.

Eleanor picked up the phone—the screen was cracked but still functional.

She dialed Jonathan Savigny.

"Any news about our daughter?"

A headline flashed—Mr. Yu had been arrested.

But the report made no mention of the bribe money.

She smirked.

Someone was determined to ruin Vincent completely.
###Chapter 445

Isabella threw open the door, her fingers digging into the doorframe.

"Mom, Dad's been taken!" Her voice trembled.

Eleanor's teacup shattered on the floor, tea splashing across the tiles.

Eleanor clenched her fists, nails biting into her palms.

She knew Vincent couldn't escape this time.

"Only one path left." Her voice was hoarse.

Isabella grabbed her arm. "What is it?"

"He always has a backup plan." Eleanor's eyes darkened. "This time, he's on his own."

It meant returning to those suffocating days of darkness.

No. She refused.

Not after pouring her life into this for over a decade.

"Mom, please save Dad!" Her voice rose to a shriek. "We're nothing without him!"

Isabella suddenly shoved her away.

"Or you just don't want to help!" she screamed hysterically.

Eleanor's pupils contracted, fearing one of her episodes.

"Get ahold of yourself!" she snapped. "Your father's more cunning than you think."

Across Red Rain Bridge, Sebastian stood silently behind glass walls.

A black-clad man materialized behind him.

"Sir, Vincent Langley's convoy has arrived."

Sebastian tapped the glass with his fingers, his sharp profile reflected in the surface.

"Proceed as planned." His tone was calm.

The man bowed and retreated.

Sebastian studied his own reflection, his gaze softening.

"Evelyn, it'll all be over soon," he murmured.

Bitterness rose in his throat. His heart constricted as if squeezed by an invisible hand.

If not for Vincent Langley...

A distant explosion suddenly lit up the sky with flames.

Sebastian's lips curved into a cold smile.

"Still playing the same old tricks."
###Chapter 446

The Imperial Bridge blazed with fire.

Sirens pierced through the night sky.

The police car carrying Vincent Langley was crushed beyond recognition.

The plan was supposed to involve the car plunging into the river—his perfect escape.

Three officers lay unconscious.

Three minutes later.

A deafening explosion rocked the air.

Blue flames slithered like venomous snakes.

Sebastian ended the call.

At the same moment.

Breaking news of the explosion flooded the internet.

Eleanor Langley stared at the television screen.

"Your father got out," she said with a twisted smile. "He'll come for us soon."

Isabella Langley watched the inferno.

"That fire..."

Then she'd finally be free.

A flicker of hope crossed Isabella's eyes.

She didn't notice the explosives looked familiar.

Outside the police station.

Adrian Valentine gripped his phone.

His knuckles turned white.

"Victor," he said, voice trembling. "Christian Lefèvre was murdered by Isabella."
###Chapter 447

Victor dozed off in the passenger seat when Adrian's icy voice jolted him awake.

All evidence pointed to her, yet he never questioned the discrepancies.

Victor wisely kept quiet.

###Chapter 448

The soy milk smelled perfectly fine to him.

After eighteen, they'd pursued separate dreams.

"Eat well. Skip the fatty meat—have more fish and chicken instead."

The realization made jealousy claw at his insides.

But she'd outgrown reckless passion long ago.

Responsibilities leave no room for caprice.

###Chapter 449 

Evelyn frowned at the breakfast spread on the table. "How did you get these?"

Adrian lounged back in his chair with a lazy smirk. "Intercepted them on the way."

This was a good time to wean Sophia off breastfeeding. Her milk supply was dwindling, and delaying would only make it harder. She didn't subscribe to Gabrielle's parenting theories—Ethan would start training at three. Sophia could wait until five or be homeschooled.

She bit into a banana pancake. The crust was crisp, the filling sweet with a hint of fruit. The pineapple pancake beside it was perfectly baked—sweet but not cloying.

Adrian took a bite and brightened. These delicate pastries weren't available commercially. His gaze lingered on Evelyn's serene profile, his lips curving unconsciously.

Sophia Blanchet treated her with utmost respect. His ex-wife clearly had hidden depths. What was her real identity? Her combat skills and marksmanship intrigued him, making him want to rediscover her.

Only true indifference made one immune to the other's actions.

Adrian ate in silence. If he angered her, she'd skip meals again. She was still too thin, yet breathtakingly beautiful.

They finished breakfast quietly. Having skipped dinner, Adrian devoured Evelyn's leftovers.

The meal was excellent. It had been ages since he'd enjoyed such satisfying food—especially with his ex-wife.

Evelyn knew instantly he hadn't eaten last night. The man never took care of himself. Before marriage, he'd scraped by with takeout. After, unless traveling, he'd always come home for dinner—then proceeded to his favorite post-meal activity: her.

Adrian packed the containers. With thirty minutes until the interrogation, his expression turned serious.

"There was a crash and explosion at Red Rain Bridge last night. Vincent might have escaped."

With Nathan Aldridge silent, Vincent's escape was almost certain.

He hadn't planned to broach this yet, wanting to investigate first.

Though lacking proof, her instincts said Isabella and Eleanor held answers—especially Isabella, whose gaze always brimmed with possessiveness.

###Chapter 450

Adrian Valentine's brow furrowed. "Must you be like this?"

Evelyn Roland lifted her gaze. "Like what?"

No matter the danger ahead, he wouldn't let go this time.

Two years of laying low had given him the power to protect her.

The empire he'd built in secret was formidable now.

Even if time rewound, he'd make the same choice. Back then, he'd been too weak to uncover the mastermind.

Vincent Langley and Eleanor Langley would stop at nothing to force their daughter into the Valentine family—with Evelyn as their target.

He'd rather bear the scorn than see her in harm's way.

The entanglement exhausted her. If they were divorced, why couldn't they just move on?

Once, she thought she couldn't live without him. Now she knew—no one was truly indispensable.

At nine sharp, the courtroom blazed with light.

Sebastian Orlando and Adrian arrived with their elite legal teams.

Vincent Kemnis arrived late, carrying crucial evidence.

Judge Song returned grim-faced. Vincent Langley had vanished—no body found at the scene.

A clear case of a staged disappearance.

Adrian didn't grace her with a glance.

Vincent played surveillance footage showing someone igniting flammable materials before the explosion—a figure resembling Evelyn.

The footage clearly showed Isabella's contorted face—though there was no audio.

Isabella paled. This evidence should have been destroyed—how?

In the defendant's seat, Evelyn sat composed, as if the trial had nothing to do with her.

Then Vincent played his trump card—Christian's final call log.

Evelyn's number flashed on the screen.
###Chapter 451

###Chapter 454

###Chapter 455

###Chapter 456

Adrian Valentine's arms suddenly felt empty, as if a piece of his heart had been carved out. His fingers clenched at his sides, knuckles turning white, barely restraining the urge to pull her back.

"Christian, I thought you were gone for good," Leonard stammered. "That's why I brought your brother home."

Leonard froze. The woman before him still carried herself with grace and dignity, while the one he truly loved had nothing but gentleness to offer.

###Chapter 457

Sophia Lefèvre stared coldly at him, her fingertips lightly tapping the desk.

"Leonard, I've kept records of every cent you've embezzled from my company over the years." Her voice was eerily calm. "Shall I calculate how many years that would land you in prison?"

His gaze instinctively darted to their son sitting on the couch, only to find Christian Lefèvre watching him with unfamiliar eyes.

"Don't spout nonsense in front of our child," Leonard forced out with false bravado.

Sophia suddenly smiled.

Slowly, she pulled a stack of documents from her bag and slammed them onto the table.

"Look. These are all the properties and cars you bought for Vanessa, along with tuition bills for your illegitimate child." Her finger landed on the final page. "And the best part—last month, you used company funds to purchase her a villa."

Leonard shot to his feet.

"Sign." Sophia pushed a pen toward him. "Or these will be delivered to the IRS and prosecutor's office tomorrow."

For the first time, Leonard truly studied the woman he'd shared a bed with for twenty years.

The emerald cheongsam she wore made her skin glow like snow. Time had been kind to her, leaving barely a trace of wrinkles at her eyes.

And Vanessa...

The image of that woman who always whined for money flashed through his mind, leaving him momentarily dazed.

"Sophia, Christian just got out of the hospital. We should—"

Click.

Sophia dialed the police without hesitation.

Leonard lunged for the phone, but Christian blocked him.

"Father." Christian's voice was glacial. "On the day of the fire, I saw Aunt Vanessa and Isabella at the café."

The words detonated like a bomb in the living room.

Sophia's pupils constricted, her fingers gripping the table edge until her knuckles turned white.

"Lies!" Leonard roared.

Christian smirked. "Shall I pull up the security footage?"

He turned to his mother. "Mom, divorce him. You've suffered enough."

Sophia's eyes reddened, but she stubbornly lifted her chin.

Leonard took in his son's icy expression and realization dawned.

"You... planned this together?"

Christian gently clasped his mother's trembling hand.

"Father, don't forget—Mom's company bears the Lefèvre name, not yours." His lips curved. "That money will keep you and Vanessa comfortable in prison for the rest of your lives."

The pen gleamed coldly under the light.

Leonard's hands began to shake.
###Chapter 458

"Leonard Lefèvre, what gives you the right to force me into divorce?" Sophia Lefèvre slammed the table, her face pale with fury.

"Leonard, our marriage has been dead for a long time."

Leonard collapsed into his chair and scrawled his signature with violent force.

"Christian, I'm so sorry..."

Christian clasped his mother's trembling hand.

"Mom, I've wanted you to leave him for years."

Sophia gazed at her son through blurred vision.

###Chapter 459

At the mention of the frosty-eyed woman, admiration flickered in her eyes. Adrian truly didn't deserve her.

"What?" Sophia stared in disbelief. "You stayed at her home. How could you not—"
###Chapter 460

Years of friendship between their families kept her tone as warm as ever.

Sophia gestured upstairs. "He's resting in his room. Go on up."

Adrian had always been steady. Surely they could clear the air between them.

His Adam's apple bobbed. "I almost got you killed."

Christian's laugh was icy, his gaze sharp as blades. Adrian hadn't known—they'd both been pawns in Isabella's game.

Adrian's eyes darkened. "Overheard their phone call and followed the trail."

Having brushed death, many things no longer seemed important.

He could walk haltingly now, though unsteadily.

After scouring all of Vienna, Evelyn's disappearance remained a mystery he couldn't unravel.
###Chapter 461

More accurately, he hadn't wanted to face what he'd heard. Looking back now, it was absurd that Isabella's words had kept him comatose for three years.

This time, Adrian didn't linger.

Three days later.

Evelyn Roland finally felt fully rested.

The cosmetic ingredients were prepped.

The Lee family had collapsed entirely during the turmoil, with the patriarch now in ICU from the shock.

###Chapter 463

She drew a sharp breath.

"We're nothing to each other anymore. Stay out of my life!"

With that, she turned on her heel and left.

Once, he had been her only light.

Then, at her happiest moment, he had snuffed it out himself.

Adrian watched her retreating figure, his gaze unreadable.

"Strangers?" He chuckled darkly. "Then let's get acquainted again."

Evelyn stormed back into the private dining room and slammed the bottle onto the table.

"What happened?" Scarlett startled.

"Ran into Adrian." Evelyn seethed. "He drank all the milk I pumped!"

Scarlett spat out her water.

"He drank breast milk?!" Her voice hit an octave higher. "He knew what it was, right?"

Evelyn massaged her temples. "He said it tasted good."

Scarlett's face went blank with disbelief.
###Chapter 472

Evelyn shook her head. "He didn't notice at all. He even complimented the taste and asked for a second cup."

Scarlett burst into laughter, slapping the table in amusement.

"Oh my god, Adrian is absolutely ridiculous!" She doubled over, tears forming at the corners of her eyes.

Evelyn sighed. "Is it really that funny?"

Wiping her tears, Scarlett gasped, "Of course! The mighty CEO of Valentine Group stealing his own child's milk!"

And he actually wanted more.

Evelyn remained silent.

She picked up a piece of steamed sea bass. Tonight's seafood feast was lavish, complete with her favorite sashimi.

Scarlett was already devouring the spicy fish.

"Evelyn, actually—"

Between her and Adrian, it was time to draw the line.

Raised in privilege, she couldn't fathom that Evelyn had begun heir training at three.

"Tristan is the heir. This is necessary." Evelyn's tone was firm. "I'll be with them often."

Scarlett fell silent. She understood the weight of an heir's duty.

After dinner, Scarlett groaned, rubbing her stomach. "I'm stuffed."

Evelyn rolled her eyes. "Serves you right for overeating. Let's walk back."

"Can I stay at your place for a few days?" Scarlett blinked hopefully.

"Suit yourself." Evelyn chuckled. "When I'm away, you can visit your brother across the street."

Laughing, they left the restaurant, unaware of Adrian watching from the shadows.

At the mention of "across the street," his eyes turned icy.

After all this time searching, she had been living right opposite Sebastian.
###Chapter 473

"The contract is signed, Mr. Valentine." Victor Ashcroft handed over the documents respectfully.

Adrian Valentine gave a slight nod.

Victor suddenly lowered his voice. "It's Ms. Roland."

The corner of Adrian's lips lifted almost imperceptibly.

The black Maybach started smoothly, maintaining a safe distance behind Evelyn Roland.

Scarlett Orlando was wrapped in an oversized trench coat, her face mostly hidden behind sunglasses.

Adrian's gaze remained fixed on that slender figure.

Evelyn was strolling down the street with Scarlett.

Daniel Sherwood gripped her wrist tightly. "Natalie, let's get back together."

"Take me away..." Her scorching breath brushed against his neck.

Her fingers crumpled his shirt, leaving behind smudges of lipstick.

Evelyn and Scarlett exchanged glances.

Inside the Maybach, Adrian's eyes darkened.

###Chapter 474

Nathan's eyes darkened, a meaningful smile playing at the corners of his lips. Natalie's cheeks flushed pink, her gaze shimmering like rippling spring water.

His Adam's apple bobbed as heat surged through him. His fingers unconsciously tightened, then slowly relaxed.

His warm breath brushed her earlobe, sending shivers through her body. She clung to him like a lifeline.

"Don't be ridiculous!" Scarlett cut her off sharply. "I'd rather have you as my sister-in-law!"

###Chapter 475

Adrian Valentine sat in his car, his gaze locked onto Evelyn Roland in the distance.

She stood by the roadside with Scarlett Orlando, laughing under the sunlight. Her radiant smile struck his heart like a sharp blade.

Sebastian Cortez's car soon arrived, and the two women got in before driving away.

"Follow them," Adrian ordered, his voice low.

Victor Ashcroft tightened his grip on the steering wheel. "Sir, Sebastian's driving skills are unmatched. I've lost him multiple times already."

Not just Sebastian—even Sophia Blanchet could easily shake him off. Everyone from Sterling Manor was a master at evasion.

True to form, a truck abruptly cut into their lane. By the time they maneuvered around it, their target had vanished without a trace.

Adrian's expression darkened. "This happens every time?"

"Yes, sir." Victor wiped the sweat from his brow.

Back at the Bamboo Whisper Villa, Adrian stood in the foyer, staring into the pitch-black living room.

He flicked the light switch. Harsh brightness flooded the space, but it couldn't dispel the hollowness inside him.

His eyes drifted toward the kitchen. There used to be a small nightlight there, with Evelyn always preparing warm midnight snacks for him.

Now, only cold countertops remained.

He collapsed onto the sofa, sinking into the plush cushions. The soft glow of the living room lights draped over him like a thin veil, accentuating his loneliness.

Longing crashed over him like tidal waves. He missed Evelyn's warm embrace, the faint scent of gardenias clinging to her skin.

The happiness he had destroyed with his own hands had become his cruelest punishment.

For three years, every night was torment. Her smiling face haunted his dreams, only to leave him with an empty bed upon waking.

His fists clenched, nails digging into his palms. Revenge wasn't complete yet, but he couldn't wait any longer.

He just wanted to return to her side—even if only to watch from afar.

Cold water cascaded over his head, failing to numb the pain in his chest. Adrian stood under the shower, letting the icy streams scour his body.

......

Morning sunlight filtered through the hospital curtains.

Eleanor Langley suddenly sat up in bed, her eyes darting around before she lunged at Jonathan Savigny with a hysterical scream. "Why did you crash into my car? I never got to see my daughter one last time!"
###Chapter 476

Her fists pounded against his chest, tears soaking through his shirt.

Eleanor jerked her head up, tears still clinging to her lashes.

"She was already cremated?" Her nails dug into her palms.

Jonathan nodded. "Adrian Valentine handled it. He wanted to give his sister a proper farewell."

Autumn wind rattled the window, carrying fallen leaves.

Eleanor shivered violently. Jonathan immediately stood to close the window.

Her gaze burned into the white hospital sheets, hatred flaring in her eyes.

"Isabella Langley will pay for this."

Sophia Blanchet hid around the corner of the hallway, her phone camera aimed at the hospital room.

She clicked her tongue and shook her head, quickly texting Evelyn Roland: "Eleanor is having an affair with her assistant. I'm going to plant surveillance at Isabella's place."

Evelyn was nursing little Sophia Roland when her phone screen lit up.

Ethan Roland sat obediently in his high chair, his cheeks smeared with carrot puree.

"Mommy." Sophia suddenly tugged at Evelyn's collar.

Gabrielle Flores laughed as she carried a bowl of soup. "Breast milk is the best nutrition. You should keep it up for another six months."

Evelyn's ears turned red.

The embarrassing moment from yesterday flashed in her mind—when she'd nearly been caught nursing by the baby's father.

"About weaning..."

Gabrielle blinked. "Let's wait until after autumn."

Sophia had already latched on with practiced ease. Evelyn sighed in resignation.
###Chapter 477

"Ma...mama..." Little Sophia tugged at her collar with tiny hands, her eyes brimming with tears.

Her rosy lips quivered, on the verge of crying.

Evelyn set down her chopsticks and carried her daughter to the sofa to nurse.

Gabrielle was playing with her grandson. "She said she's going to watch a play."

"A play?" Evelyn arched an eyebrow.

"Something about Nathan's performance. She left early this morning." Gabrielle smiled knowingly.

Evelyn understood instantly.

That girl actually went to spy on Nathan and Natalie?

Natalie woke to sunlight streaming through the curtains.

She tried to turn over, but her body ached as if she'd been run over.

Memories of last night flooded back.

She bolted upright, scanning the room.

A hotel suite.

She had really slept with Nathan...

A bitter smile tugged at Natalie's lips.

Men were all the same.

The sound of running water came from the bathroom.

She looked down at the marks scattered across her skin and shook her head with a wry laugh.

A neatly folded set of fresh clothes lay on the bedside table.

At least Nathan was considerate.

Gritting her teeth, she dressed her sore body.

Her legs gave out the moment she stood, sending her crashing to her knees.

That man had too much stamina.

One last glance at the blurred silhouette behind the frosted glass, and Natalie clenched her jaw as she left the room.

She chewed on her straw, eyes locked on the revolving door.

"Cough—!"

"Nathan, you sly dog!"

"Victoria! Breaking news!" she shrieked as soon as the call connected. "Nathan actually slept with Natalie!"

Evelyn patted Sophia's back to burp her. "You're at the hotel?"

###Chapter 478

Evelyn raised an eyebrow. "You actually staked out the hotel? Scarlett, you're unbelievable!"

"Pfft."

Evelyn massaged her temples. No wonder the girl had disappeared this morning—she'd gone to indulge in gossip. How bored was she?

Rich people's problems really just boiled down to finding amusement.

Evelyn sighed. "I wish they'd settle down already. They're all at that age, still single. As their older sister, it's frustrating."

They'd grown up together, and Evelyn genuinely wanted them to find happiness.

Huh? That wasn't right.
She'd never seen him look so furious before.

Whatever. Spoiled gossip wasn't worth it. Time to go home and nap.
Scarlett summoned her driver and made a quick escape.

Nathan was seething.
He'd stepped out of the shower to find Natalie gone.

After initiating everything last night, she'd slipped away while he was showering?
He'd see how far she could run.

It wasn't their first meeting, yet when he saw her ex-husband drugging her drink last night—and her blindly drinking it—

Evelyn didn't interfere with Nathan's affairs.
She never meddled in her siblings' love lives.

After eighteen, they had their freedom—her only rule was to never expose her true identity.

"Sophia, time to eat."
Evelyn reached for her daughter.

Evelyn gently pinched her nose. "Ouch..."

###Chapter 479

Felicia understood her mother's words immediately and burst into loud, dramatic sobs.

Evelyn Roland: "..."

If she's like this now, she'll probably cry herself unconscious when she's older.

Zachary Deross had been waiting by the car.

Her voice was glacial.

Adrian's fingers twitched. "This way."

###Chapter 480

Beatrice Valentine gazed at Evelyn Roland with grandmotherly affection, the corners of her eyes crinkling with warmth.

"I'm so happy you came to visit this old woman."

A sigh escaped Beatrice's lips as wisdom flickered in her aged eyes.

"Don't worry, Grandmother. I'm doing well now."

Her voice carried the calm of still waters, three years having smoothed away old wounds.

Evelyn withdrew her hand. "Let the past stay in the past."

Her eyes held steady certainty.

"Mr. Valentine and I are finished. You've always understood things clearly."

Adrian's face darkened instantly, fists clenching at his sides.

Three years. She'd thought the truth would surface in two.

###Chapter 481

"He visits that place every year. Someone important to him is there." Evelyn Roland explained softly.

Beatrice Valentine's eyes flickered with recognition. An old flame?

He still remembered?

The weak pulse confirmed Evelyn's fears. Beatrice seemed to have lost the will to live.

She didn't elaborate, fearing to burden Evelyn with excessive sentimentality.

"Grandmother, Adrian still faces many dangers. Will you abandon him?"

"Those threats can't touch him anymore."

Beatrice lowered her eyes, shadows crossing her face. She'd known wealth and privilege, experienced true love in her lifetime.

With a devoted father and filial son, she should have no regrets.

Yet her only child had died young, leaving only her grandson behind.

Seeing Beatrice sink deeper into melancholy, Evelyn grew anxious. Treating elderly patients who'd given up on life was notoriously difficult.

"Grandmother." Evelyn understood Beatrice had resisted waking after fainting the previous night.

Beatrice opened her eyes slowly, their usual sharpness clouded over.

The sight pierced Evelyn's heart.

"Evelyn, promise you'll take care of yourself." Suddenly, Beatrice seemed slightly more alert, her gaze clearing momentarily.

Her grandson had grown into a capable man. Her sole regret was his divorce from Evelyn.

"Grandmother, don't you want to witness our happiness? We haven't even had our wedding yet. You can't leave like this."

Adrian finally spoke up. Having been protected by Beatrice since childhood, he couldn't accept her slipping away like this.

He'd anticipated this moment—once his father's death was avenged, Beatrice would lose her reason to keep fighting. When his grandfather passed, she'd wanted to follow him then, only staying for revenge.

Evelyn shot him a silent look. How could he say such things?

She hadn't agreed to reconcile.

She still had her own path to walk.

Beatrice's eyes suddenly brightened, darting between Evelyn and Adrian. She genuinely wished they'd reunite—for the Valentine family's stability.

And Evelyn had always been her ideal granddaughter-in-law.

###Chapter 482

She would never forgive him.

###Chapter 483

No divorce record?

Her voice trembled. "So... my marital status is still... married?"
###Chapter 484 

The clerk looked bewildered by Evelyn's question.

"Ma'am, aren't you here to replace your marriage certificate? How could we issue a replacement if you weren't legally married? Let me process that for you right away."

Evelyn froze in place.

The efficient clerk soon handed her a brand new crimson booklet.

She stumbled out of the civil affairs office like a ghost.

Sunshine bathed the streets, but her heart felt weighed down by stones.

Adrian Valentine had deceived her for years.

"Adrian, you lying bastard!" she muttered through clenched teeth. "We've been over for ages!"

She'd specifically inquired about divorce procedures during breastfeeding periods. Court intervention would expose their twins' existence.

Sunlight gilded his hair as he stood there with that infuriating smirk.
